newsitem.title: USA: Carter-Wallace gets purchase offer - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Carter-Wallace gets purchase offer - WSJ.

text.p: U.S. investor Marvin Davis has offered to buy Carter-Wallace Inc for $835 million or $18 a share, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.
The newspaper said Davis was interested in buying all of the outstanding stock in the company, which makes consumer and health-care produtcs like condoms and deodorant.
It said the company had not made the offer public and had given it for consideration to its majority shareholder, CPI Development Corp.
The newspaper it said had obtained copies of the letter sent by Davis offering to buy Carter-Wallace and the one with the company's initial response to it.
Neither party wanted to comment on the purchase offer, it said.
